StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_CreateFYProgramAlloca.onPlan]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@PeriodCode int, @FY int, @BeginDate date.me, @EndDate date.me, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
SET NOCOUNT ON
DECLARE @DBID INT DECLARE @DBNAME NVARCHAR(128) DECLARE @ERRMSG VARCHAR(200)
SET @DBID = DB_ID() SET @DBNAME = DB_NAME()
IF EXISTS (SELECT PROGRAM_PERIOD_ID FROM PROGRAM_PERIOD WHERE FY = @FY AND PERIOD_CODE = @PeriodCode) BEGIN --- Raise Error and return SET @ERRMSG = 'A program alloca.on plan already exists for FY ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR, @FY) + '.' RAISERROR (@ERRMSG, 16, 1, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
IF EXISTS (SELECT PROGRAM_PERIOD_ID FROM PROGRAM_PERIOD WHERE FY = @FY AND DATEDIFF(DAY, END_DATE, @EndDate) <= 0) BEGIN --- Raise Error and return SET @ERRMSG = 'The periods in the FY program alloca.on plan can not overlap. Please adjust the End Date for Period ' + CONVERT(VARCHAR, @PeriodCode) + '.' RAISERROR (@ERRMSG, 16, 2, @DBID, @DBNAME) RETURN END
--- OTHERWISE PROCEED WITH INSERT INSERT INTO PROGRAM_PERIOD (PERIOD_CODE, FY, BEGIN_DATE, END_DATE, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE) VALUES (@PeriodCode, @FY, @BeginDate, @EndDate, @UserLogin, GETDATE())
